intro: Thapsia polygama var. hispida, commonly known as the hispid thapsia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant features finely hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal areas. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
